summary: Project scope includes UI/navigation refinements for the web app (move main menu to a bottom button on the main/home interface, repurpose the hamburger/three-lines menu to settings/close/logout, and add a theme toggle), plus sharing/accessibility requests (shareable link for colleagues and improved add-to-home-screen/PWA access), alongside existing deployment/SEO goals and potential APK distribution goals, with an added request to support Google Ads/AdSense readiness for monetization/advertising.
architectural_notes: Frontend uses React + Vite with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui component primitives.
ICP backend is a Motoko canister with Candid bindings generated for the frontend.
Authentication is designed around Internet Identity; frontend provides hooks for login state and actor creation.
Project includes a build/deploy template (Docker/deploy script/canister configs) to support reproducible ICP builds.
Build template now includes custom ESLint rules (e.g., bigint query key guard, required Internet Identity provider) and additional shadcn/ui primitives.
Build tooling includes image maintenance scripts (resize/prune) alongside Docker/deploy configuration to keep frontend assets optimized.
Backend includes reusable authorization/access-control modules to enable permission-checked operations.
Frontend adds an admin area with route guarding (AdminGuard) and a dedicated admin session hook (useAdminSession) layered on top of Internet Identity/actor utilities.
Frontend introduces additional domain pages (Clubs/Club Detail/History/Membership Registration) and admin workflow pages (Membership Review/History Editor) integrated into App routing/layout.
Public/main pages should render club data fetched from the backend as read-only; mutations (create/update/delete) are only available via admin-gated UI.
known_issues: Google Search Console verification failing with "site not found" because the production site HTML does not currently expose the expected google-site-verification meta tag; requires publishing the latest (v9) deployment to production and re-verifying.
Production deployment is showing an incorrect logo/image (not the user-provided asset), including within the admin interface.

existing_features.title: Motoko backend canister scaffold
existing_features.description: Backend canister implemented in Motoko with generated Candid interface and frontend declarations wired for local/dev builds.

existing_features.title: React + Vite + Tailwind frontend scaffold
existing_features.description: Frontend app bootstrapped with Vite/React, Tailwind CSS, shared layout, and app entry wiring.

existing_features.title: Multi-page site structure with core pages
existing_features.description: Implemented core pages: Home, Programs, Events, About, and Contact, with shared AppLayout and top navigation/footer components.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication integration (hooks)
existing_features.description: Client-side hooks for Internet Identity login state and actor creation (useInternetIdentity/useActor) integrated into the frontend infrastructure.

existing_features.title: Backend actor/query utilities
existing_features.description: Typed backend bindings and query/actor helper hooks/utilities (e.g., backend.ts, backend.d.ts, useQueries) set up for calling the canister from the frontend.

existing_features.title: shadcn/ui component library included
existing_features.description: shadcn/ui component set and related configs (eslint rules, components registry, UI primitives) added to the project/template.

existing_features.title: Build/deploy template and tooling for ICP project
existing_features.description: Build template assets added (Dockerfile, deploy script, canister yaml configs, workspace/package configs, and image processing scripts) to support reproducible builds and deployment.

existing_features.title: Generated brand/hero image assets
existing_features.description: Generated and included branded image assets for hero, icons, and logo in the frontend public assets.

existing_features.title: Backend authorization/access-control utilities (Motoko)
existing_features.description: Motoko backend updated with reusable authorization mixin/access-control module(s) to support permission checks for protected operations.

existing_features.title: Admin section with guarded routes and admin session hooks
existing_features.description: Frontend includes admin login and protected admin routes/pages with AdminGuard and admin session utilities (useAdminSession) integrated alongside existing Internet Identity actor/auth hooks.

existing_features.title: Expanded site pages: Clubs, Club Detail, History, and Membership Registration
existing_features.description: Added additional public/feature pages beyond the initial core set, including Clubs listing, Club detail, History page, and Membership registration page wired into the app routing/layout.

existing_features.title: Admin workflows pages: Membership Review and History Editor
existing_features.description: Added admin-facing workflow pages for reviewing memberships and editing history content, accessible via the admin section.

existing_features.title: Add React Query hooks to read/write minor club records via the backend actor (list clubs, get club by id, upsert club, delete club), following the existing patterns used for history and membership registrations.

Replace the current static club data used by the public Clubs page and Club Detail page with data fetched from the backend club APIs, and display the new club fields (aims, motto, slogan, achievements, program, activities, history) on the club detail view.
Add an admin-gated “Minor Clubs Manager” UI that allows admins to create, update, and delete clubs and edit the fields: aims, motto, slogan, achievements, program, activities, and history.
Connect the club management interface to the existing admin login/dashboard and the membership interface, so it is easy for an admin to reach club editing from those entry points.
Add an admin UI (within the existing admin area) that allows admins to add, edit, and remove social media accounts/links, using English user-facing text.

Display admin-managed social media links on the public-facing site (e.g., footer and/or main/home page) as read-only content with no public editing controls; all edits must happen only in the admin interface.

Create a new admin page reachable from the admin area as a sub-navigation item labeled “About” that lets admins add/edit/update the About content (Community Building, Skill Development, Events & Activities, and the links “Our Programs” and “Upcoming Events”).
Create a new admin page in the admin area to customize Home page content, including editing the “What We Do / Explore Programs” section, and ensure all saved changes appear on the public Home page.
Render the admin-managed About content on the public Home page so that updates made in the admin “About” page appear on the Home page.

Update the existing Minor Clubs Manager admin UI to include a “Profile Picture” control for each club, and display the profile picture on public club views (Clubs list and Club Detail) with a fallback when none is set.

Add React Query hooks (or extend existing hooks) to fetch and update the new About content and Home page configuration via the backend actor, following the patterns used by existing history/social links hooks.
Improve SEO/indexing readiness for Google by adding standard metadata and crawlable static files for the deployed site.

Make the site’s SEO/indexing configuration work with the actual deployed production URL (instead of hardcoded placeholders), including updating/parameterizing canonical URL and sitemap/robots URLs so Google can correctly crawl and index the deployed site.
Add PWA support so visitors on Android can install the site, including a web app manifest, required PWA icons, and service worker registration compatible with the current Vite + React setup.

Add an install prompt UI on the public Home page that encourages Android users to install the app, using English user-facing text and only showing the prompt when installation is supported and the app is not already installed.

Provide project documentation for producing an Android APK from the deployed PWA (e.g., via Trusted Web Activity), including clear prerequisites and step-by-step instructions, without introducing unsupported backend services.

Insert the provided Google Search Console verification meta tag into the HTML <head> so Google can verify ownership for the production site (https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io), and redeploy the site.

Deploy the current frontend and backend canisters to the production environment so the site is publicly accessible at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io and Google Search Console can verify ownership using the existing verification meta tag already present in frontend/index.html.

Publish version 9 (the latest build) to the production Internet Computer canisters so the public site at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io serves the current frontend bundle and backend canister, and the Google Search Console verification meta tag is present in the rendered HTML <head>.

Publish the current application version (the build the assistant labeled “Version 10”) to the production Internet Computer canisters so the public site is served at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io.

Ensure Google Search Console verification can succeed by confirming that the deployed production HTML exposes the Google verification meta tag in the rendered <head> for https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io.

Update the production deployment documentation to reflect deploying the current version (Version 10) for Google Search Console verification, keeping the production URL https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io unchanged.
Replace the current top-navigation logo image with the provided app logo image, and ensure the top-navigation uses the updated logo asset everywhere it appears (desktop header and mobile menu).

Change the top-navigation heading text so it never displays the abbreviation “YFO”, and instead always displays “The Youth And Friends Organization” (including mobile layouts and the mobile menu header).

Fix the site-wide header logo so the same correct logo is shown consistently on all pages (including admin pages), by removing any hardcoded/incorrect logo filename usage and using a single canonical logo source throughout the frontend.

Create an admin page in the existing admin area that allows admins to update the app branding logo using an explicit control with English user-facing text (including an "Add picture/video"-style media button, constrained to images for the logo).
Implement a reusable "Add picture or video" media picker control for admin editing workflows that supports selecting a local image or video file and produces a storable URL/string value for saving.

Extend admin editable pages so that wherever admins edit content, the UI includes the same "Add picture or video" control, and any selected media is saved and loaded back when revisiting the editor (cover at minimum: History editor, About content editor, and Home page editor).

Move the primary navigation menu (Home/About/Programs/Events/Clubs/History/Membership/Contact/Me) out of the mobile hamburger (three-lines) menu and make it accessible from the Home page via a bottom-positioned button that opens the main menu.
Change the mobile hamburger (three-lines) menu contents to include only: Settings, Close, and Logout (using English user-facing text).
Add a Settings UI that includes a theme toggle button to switch between Light and Dark mode, persisting the selected theme across page reloads.

Provide a shareable public access link in the UI that users can copy and send to colleagues; use the production URL https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io as the default share link text shown to the user.

Improve add-to-home-screen discoverability by adding an “Install app” entry point inside Settings that triggers the existing PWA install flow when available, and otherwise shows a short English message guiding the user to use the browser’s “Add to Home screen” option.

Update the existing Android APK documentation to clearly explain how to produce an APK from the deployed PWA URL and explicitly clarify what is and is not supported regarding Google Play distribution (e.g., signing, Play Console submission steps are outside the app build system).
Deploy the latest application build (current latest version) to the production Internet Computer canisters so the public site is served at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io.

Ensure the deployed production HTML contains the Google Search Console verification meta tag in the rendered <head> on https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0-io, and fail the build/deploy process if the meta tag is missing (using the existing build-time verification script).

Make the public production site URL clearly available to the user for sharing/advertising by surfacing the existing production URL (https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io) in a prominent, easy-to-copy location in the public UI (in addition to the existing Settings share link).
Add Google AdSense readiness by serving an ads.txt file from the site root and documenting where to put the publisher content, without requiring any backend changes.

Add an optional, configuration-driven AdSense script include so the site can be linked to Google AdSense when the user provides their AdSense publisher/client identifier, without hardcoding any account-specific IDs into the repository.

Add basic, crawlable policy pages commonly required for advertising/monetization review: a Public Privacy Policy page and a Public Terms page, linked from the site footer using English user-facing text.

Promote the currently deployed draft (Version 16) to the production Internet Computer canisters so the public site serves the Version 16 frontend bundle and backend at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io.

Run the existing production build verification that checks for the Google Search Console verification meta tag, and block the production promotion if the tag is missing from the rendered HTML <head> output.

Ensure the AdSense readiness static file is accessible from the production site root by confirming /ads.txt is served at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io/ads.txt after the production deployment.

Add a new action in the mobile hamburger menu (the same menu that currently contains Settings, Close, and Logout in `frontend/src/components/TopNav.tsx`) labeled "Share link" that allows the user to quickly copy the public site URL to the clipboard from that menu.

Promote/publish Draft Version 18 to the production Internet Computer canisters so the public site at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io includes the Share button on the publicly accessible UI.

Update the existing Share entry point (currently a copy-link action) so that clicking it opens the device/browser native share prompt (Web Share API) when available, allowing users to choose a destination app/service (e.g., Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, Google Drive, Messages, and other installed share targets).

Promote/publish the current draft build (Draft Version 19) to the production Internet Computer canisters so the public site at https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io serves the Version 19 frontend bundle and corresponding backend canister.

Run the existing production build verification that checks for the Google Search Console verification meta tag and block production promotion if the verification meta tag is missing from the rendered HTML head.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add admin-gated interface (linked from membership button/admin login area) to create/update/edit minor club details: aims, motto, slogan, achievements, programs, activities, and history.

Extend the Motoko backend to persist and serve “minor club” records including: id, name, aims, motto, slogan, achievements, program, activities, and history, with public query access for reading and admin-only access for create/update/delete.
Add a conditional Motoko stable-state migration for the newly introduced stable club storage so the canister can upgrade safely from the current deployed state.

Extend the admin minor-clubs manager so admins can add/update social media account links (e.g., Facebook/Instagram/X/Website/etc.) for clubs, and ensure all admin-edited club data is displayed on the public/main pages as read-only (no public editing outside the admin interface).
Add backend support for storing and serving organization social media links that can be created/updated only by admins and read publicly.
Add a conditional Motoko stable-state migration for the newly introduced social media links state so the canister can upgrade safely from the currently deployed state.

Add an admin “About” sub-button/page under the admin interface where admins can add/edit/update About content and related links (e.g., community building, skill development, events/activities, “our program”, “upcoming events”) and have it render on the public homepage.
Add admin-editable homepage section(s) for “Explore program / What we do” so admins can add/edit/update the content and have changes appear on the public homepage.
Add a homepage customization interface in the admin area to control what content/sections appear on the homepage and ensure all admin edits are reflected on the homepage.
Extend club management so admins can add/update a profile picture for each minor club (upload/select image) and display it on public club views.
Add production hosting/public deployment plan so the site is accessible to anyone and is indexable on Google Search (SEO + indexing readiness).
Provide an APK build/distribution option for the site/app (e.g., Android wrapper/PWA-to-APK), if feasible.

Add backend data models and APIs to store and serve admin-managed “About” content that includes the items: Community Building, Skill Development, Events & Activities, plus link-style items for “Our Programs” and “Upcoming Events”, and make this content publicly readable and admin-writable.

Add backend data models and APIs to store and serve an admin-managed Home page configuration so that the “Explore Programs / What we do” section content can be added/edited/updated by admins and reflected on the public Home page.
Extend the backend Club record and club create/update APIs to support an admin-set “profile picture” value for each minor club, and ensure it is returned in public club queries.

Implement any required conditional stable-state migration(s) in Motoko so existing deployed state can upgrade safely while adding the new About content, Home page configuration, and club profile picture field.
Add an install prompt on the homepage for Android users (PWA install banner / prompt visitors to install the app).

Add Google Search Console verification by inserting the provided google-site-verification meta tag into the site’s HTML <head> for the production domain (https://pd5nf-fqaaa-aaaan-qetaq-cai.icp0.io), then redeploy so ownership can be verified and indexing can proceed.
Publish the current build/version to the production ICP canisters so the live site is updated and Google Search Console verification can succeed.
Replace the current app/site picture (image asset) with the picture used on the app.
Update the site/app header heading text from “YFO” to “the youth and friends organization”.

Add admin UI support across all editable/admin-managed sections to attach/upload media (images and videos) when creating/updating content, via a consistent "Add picture/video" button available wherever edits occur.
Add backend support for an admin-managed app branding configuration that includes a logo media field, readable publicly and writable only by admins.

Update the backend data model and APIs as needed to persist media attachments for History content, About sections, and Home page sections in stable storage, with admin-only write access and public read access.
Add a conditional Motoko stable-state migration so deployed canisters can upgrade safely after changing stable types required to store branding/logo and editor media attachments.

Update the main interface navigation: move the main menu out of the hamburger (three-lines) and make it appear as a bottom button on the main/home UI; change the hamburger menu to contain only Settings, Close, and Logout.
Add a Settings UI that includes a theme toggle button to switch between dark and light mode (and vice versa).

Provide a shareable access link (public URL) that can be sent to colleagues to preview/use the web app, and ensure the app can be accessed via an add-to-home-screen style workflow (PWA install) even before Google Search Console verification is completed.

Make the site compatible with Google AdSense/ads workflows (e.g., ensure required verification/ownership steps and any needed site metadata/policies/pages are supported) so the user can link the site to Google AdSense and run Google Ads.
Deploy/push the currently deployed draft (Version 16) to the production ICP canisters so the user can share the live link and proceed with Google Ads/AdSense.
Add a “Share” button entry in the mobile hamburger menu (where Close and Logout are) so users can quickly copy/get the public link from that menu.

Update the in-app Share button behavior so clicking it opens a platform share prompt/sheet with share targets such as Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, Google Drive, Messages, etc. (not just copying the link).
Publish/promote Draft Version 18 to production so the public link includes the Share button.
Publish/promote Draft Version 19 to production so the enhanced share options go live on the public site.

Verify that the enhanced Share behavior is live on production: using the app’s existing Share entry points should invoke the native share prompt (Web Share API) when available and fall back to copying the public URL to the clipboard when not available.

projectName: Add admin-managed minor club information (CRUD) and connect it to membership/admin UI
